title: compareGroups 4.0: Descriptives by groups
text: compareGroups package (Subirana, Sanz, Vila 2014) allows users create tables displaying results univariate analyses, stratified categorical variable groupings. Tables can easily exported CSV, LaTeX, HTML, PDF, Word Excel, inserted R-markdown files generate reports automatically. package can used R prompt user-friendly graphical user interface non-R familiarized users. compareGroups package available CRAN repository. load package using R prompt, enter: document provides overview usage compareGroups package real examples, using R syntax graphical user interface. structure follows: Introduction package (section 2) data used example (section 3), Instructions perform descriptive tables exploration plots using R syntax explained (section 4), Usage graphical user interface based tcl-tk (section 5) based Shiny (section 6) shown.
code: library(compareGroups)

title: compareGroups 4.0: Descriptives by groups
text: compareGroups package three functions: printed summarized plotted updated printed summarized export2csv, export2html, export2latex, export2pdf, export2md, export2word export2xls export results CSV, HTML, LaTeX, PDF, Markdown, Word Excel, respectively. Figure 1 shows package structured terms functions, classes methods.   Since version 4.0, new function called descrTable implemented shortcut compareGroupsand createTable, .e. step 1 step 2 single step (see section 4.2.5).

title: compareGroups 4.0: Descriptives by groups
text: illustrate package works took sample REGICOR study. REGICOR cross-sectional study participants north-east region Spain different sets variables collected: demographic (age, sex, …), anthropomorphic (height, weight, waist, …), lipid profile (total cholesterol, triglycerides, …), questionnaires (physical activity, quality life, …), etc. Also, cardiovascular events mortality obtained hospital official registries reports along 10 years. First , load REGICOR data typing:  Variables labels data frame :  OBSERVATIONS: important note compareGroups aimed perform quality control data. useful packages 2lh (Genolini, Desgraupes, Franca 2011) available purpose. strongly recommended data.frame contain variables analyzed; ones needed present analysis removed list. nature variables analyzed known, least variables used categorical. important code categorical variables factors order levels meaningful package. label variables set “label” attributes . tables results contain variable labels (default).
code: data(regicor)

title: compareGroups 4.0: Descriptives by groups
text: dot occurs right side ~ variables data frame used. remove variable id analysis, use - formula: select explanatory variables (e.g., age, sex bmi) store results object class compareGroups: Note: Although full data (n= 2294) Age Sex, missing data body mass index (bmi). Mean values body mass index statistically different among recruitment years (p-value < 0.05), Age Sex statistically related recruitment year (p-value > 0.05). Age & BMI used continuous normal distributed, sex categorical. filters used (e.g., selecting treated patients); therefore, selection column lists “” (variables).

title: compareGroups 4.0: Descriptives by groups
text: Since 4.0 version, export2md supports cbind.createTable class objects, .e. exporting stratified descriptive tables. Also, nicer customizable tables can reported making use kableExtra package (size, strip rows, etc.). Following, examples exporting HTML. First create descriptive table REGICOR variables recruitment year. Default export2md HTML: Summary descriptives table groups `Recruitment year’ Add strip rows, colouring rows variables: Summary descriptives table groups `Recruitment year’ Change size: Summary descriptives table groups `Recruitment year’ Making variable names column wider: Summary descriptives table groups `Recruitment year’ Stratified table: Summary descriptive tables
code: res <- compareGroups(year ~ ., regicor) restab <- createTable(res, hide.no="no") export2md(restab) export2md(restab, strip=TRUE, first.strip=TRUE) export2md(restab, size=6) export2md(restab, width="400px") restab <- strataTable(descrTable(year ~ . -id, regicor), "sex") export2md(restab, size=8)

what: Using the Graphical User Inferface (GUI) - tcltk
title: compareGroups 4.0: Descriptives by groups
text: compareGroups package loaded, Graphical User Interface (GUI) displayed response typing cGroupsGUI(regicor). GUI meant make feasible users unfamiliar R construct bivariate tables. Note , since version 3.0, necessary specifiy existing data.frame input. , example, can load REGICOR data typing data(regicor) calling cGroupsGUI function. section illustrate, step step, construct bivariate table containing descriptives groups regicor data using GUI: Summary descriptives table groups `Recruitment year’  Step 1. Browse select data loaded. Valid file types include SPSS R format, CSV plain text file data.frame already existing Workspace. need specify data set. example regicor data loaded.   Step 2. Choose variables described (row-variables).   Step 3. descriptives recruitment year desired (example), move variable year GUI top frame, making factor variable. report descriptives whole sample (.e., groups), click “none” button.   Step 4. possible hide first, last categories categorical row-variable. example, “Male” levels hidden Sex; conversely, categories shown categorical variables.   Step 5. continuous variable, possible specify whether treat normal non-normal transform numerical variable categorical one. last option can interesting categorical variable coded numerical. default, continuous variables treated normal. example, triglycerides treated non-normal, .e., median quartiles reported instead mean standard deviation.   Step 6. row-variable, possible select subset individuals data set included. example, descriptives systolic diastolic blood pressure (sbp dbp) reported htn treatment. Also, possible specify criteria select subset individuals included row-variables: type logical condition (selection criteria individuals) “Global subset” window instead “Variable subset”.   Step 7. bivariate table characteristics can set clicking “Report options” main menu, report descriptives (mean, frequencies, medians, etc.), display p-trend, show relative frequencies.   Step 8. Finally, specify bivariate table format (LaTeX, CVS plain text HTML). Clicking “print”” display bivariate table, well summary (available data, etc.), R console. table can also exported file formats listed.

title: Example 1: Building a descriptive table.
text: Compute descriptives tests selected variables using compareGroups function.  Note use formula argument usual R, “.” indicates variables dataset “-” sign indicates removing, variable left side “~” sign indicates groups (descriptives whole datset without separating groups desired left blank). Store results object can used afterwards perform plots bivariate table . argument method set triglycerides (triglyc), days cardiovascular event (tocv) days death (todeath) variables reported median quartiles instead mean standard deviation.

title: Example 1: Building a descriptive table.

Using function can customize categorical variables displayed (percertage absolute frequencies ) type argument whether standard deviation appears inside brackets separated plus/minus symbol sd.type argument.  Also note use hide.category useful hide “” level binary variables.  want show “Female” category use hide argument sex variable indicating category going hiden. argument also applies categorical variables two categories. specify number decimal digits show use digitsarguments. example height decimals weight three digits. Finally, want show many individuals non-missing values described variable, set show.n argument TRUE.
code: restab <- createTable(res, digits = c(height=0, weight=3), type = 1, sd.type = 2,                        hide = c(sex = "Male"), hide.no = "no", show.n = TRUE)

title: Descriptives by groups — compareGroups
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class). Right side ~ must terms additive way, left side ~ must contain name grouping variable can left blank (latter case descriptives whole sample calculated test performed). data optional data frame, list environment (object coercible '.data.frame' data frame) containing variables model. found 'data', variables taken 'environment(formula)'. subset optional vector specifying subset individuals used computation process. applied row-variables. 'subset' 'selec' added sense '&' applied every row-variable. na.action function indicates happen data contain NAs. default NULL, equivalent na.pass, means action. Value na.exclude can useful desired removed individuals NA variable. y vector variable distinguishes groups. must either numeric, character, factor NULL. Default value NULL means descriptives whole sample calculated test performed. Xext data.frame matrix rows / individuals contained X, maybe different variables / columns X. argument used compareGroups.default sense variables specified argument selec searched Xext /.GlobalEnv. Xext NULL, Xext created variables X plus y. Default value NULL. selec list many components row-variables. list length 1 recycled row-variables. Every component 'selec' expression evaluated select individuals analyzed every row-variable. Otherwise, named list specifying 'selec' row-variables applied. title: Descriptives by groups — compareGroups
text: Depending whether row-variable considered continuous normal-distributed (1), continuous non-normal distributed (2) categorical (3), following descriptives tests performed:    1- mean, standard deviation t-test ANOVA    2- median, 1st 3rd quartiles (default), Kruskall-Wallis test    3- absolute relative frequencies chi-squared exact Fisher test expected frequencies less 5 cell Also, row-variable can class 'Surv'. probability 'event' fixed time (set 'timemax' argument) computed logrank test performed. 2 groups, also performs pairwise comparisons adjusting multiple testing (Tukey row-variable normal-distributed Benjamini & Hochberg method otherwise), computes p-value trend. p-value trend computed Pearson test row-variable normal Spearman test continuous non normal. Also, continuous non normal distributed variables, possible compute p-value trend using Kendall's test (method='kendall' cor.test) Cuzick's test (cuzickTest). row-variable class 'Surv', score test computed Cox model grouping variable introduced integer variable predictor. row-variable categorical, p-value trend computed Mantel-Haenszel test trend. two groups, Odds Ratio Risk Ratio computed row-variable. , response class 'Surv' (.e. time event) Hazard Ratios computed. x-variable factor, Odds Ratio Risk Ratio computed using oddsratio riskratio, respectively, epitools package. x-variable continuous variable, Odds Ratio Risk Ratio computed logistic regression canonical link log link, respectively. p-values Hazard Ratios computed using logrank Wald test Cox proportional hazard regression row-variable categorical continuous, respectively. See vignette detailed examples illustrating use function methods used.

what: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
title: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
text: function provides extensive summary range SNP data, allowing perform -depth quality control genotyping results, explore data analysis. Summary measures include allele genotype frequencies counts, missingness rate, Hardy Weinberg equilibrium whole data set stratified variables, case-control status. can also test differences missingness groups.

title: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
code: compareSNPs(formula, data, subset, na.action = NULL, sep = "", verbose = FALSE, ...)

title: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
text: formula object class "formula" (one can coerced class). right side ~ must terms additive way, terms must refer variables 'data' must character factor classes whose levels genotypes alleles written levels (e.g. /, /T T/T). left side ~ must contain name grouping variable can left blank (case, summary data provided whole sample, missingness test performed). data optional data frame, list environment (object coercible '.data.frame' data frame) containing variables model. found 'data', variables taken 'environment(formula)'. subset optional vector specifying subset individuals used computation process (applied genetic variables). na.action function indicates happen data contain NAs. default NULL, equivalent na.pass, means action. Value na.exclude can useful desired removed individuals NA variable. sep character string indicating separator alleles (e.g. using /, /T T/T genotype codification, 'sep' set '/'. Default value ” indicating genotypes coded AA, TT. verbose logical, print results HWChisq function. Default value FALSE. ... currently ignored.

title: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
text: object class 'compareSNPs' data.frame (groups specified left '~' 'formula' argument) list data.frames, otherwise. data.frame contains following fields:    - Ntotal: Total number samples genotyping attempted    - Ntyped: Number genotypes called    - Typed.p: Percentage genotyped    - Miss.t: Number missing genotypes     - Miss.p: Proportion missing genotypes       - Minor: Minor Allele           - MAF: Minor allele frequency     - A1: Allele 1        - A2: Allele 2        - A1.ct: Count Allele 1     - A2.ct: Count Allele 2     - A1.p: Frequency Allele 1    - A2.p: Frequency Allele 2      - Hom1: Allele 1 Homozygote      - Het: Heterozygote       - Hom2: Allele 2 Homozygote     - Hom1.ct: Allele 1 Homozygote count     - Het.ct: Heterozygote Count        - Hom2.ct: Allele 2 Homozygote count    - Hom1.p: Frequency Allele 1 Homozygote      - Het.p: Heterozygote frequency         - Hom2.p: Frequency Allele 2 Homozygote     - HWE.p: Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium p-value  Additionaly, analysis stratified groups, last component consists data.frame containing p-values missingness comparison among groups. 'print' returns 'nice' format table group main results SNP (Ntotal, Ntyped, Minor, MAF, A1, A2, HWE.p), missingness test group considered.

title: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
text: uses functions taken SNPassoc created Juan Ram?n Gonz?lez et al. Hardy-Weinberg equilibrium test performed using  HWChisqMat

title: Summarise genetic data by groups. — compareSNPs
text: Gavin Lucas (gavin.lucas<>cleargenetics.com) Isaac Subirana (isubirana<>imim.es)

a) By rows: takes the first four variables as a group and the rest as another group: rbind("First group of variables"=restab[1:4],"Second group of variables"=   restab[5:length(res)])  # b) By columns: puts stratified tables by sex one beside the other: res1<-compareGroups(year ~ . - id - sex, regicor) restab1<-createTable(res1, hide.no = 'no') restab2<-update(restab1, x = update(res1, subset = sex == 'Male')) restab3<-update(restab1, x = update(res1, subset = sex == 'Female')) cbind("ALL" = restab1, "MALES" = restab2, "FEMALES" = restab3)  } # title: Exports tables to PDF files. — export2pdf
text: x object class 'createTable' inherits . file character specifying PDF file resulting compiling LaTeX code corresponding table specified 'x' argument. LaTeX code also stored folder name .tex extension. 'compile' argument FALSE, .tex file saved. .table character indicating table printed. Possible values 'descr', 'avail' '' (partial matching allowed), printing descriptives groups table, availability data table tables, respectively. Default value 'descr'. nmax logical, indicating whether show number subjects least one valid value across row-variables. Default value TRUE. header.labels character named vector '', 'p.overall', 'p.trend', 'ratio', 'p.ratio' 'N' components indicating label '[]', 'p.overall', 'p.trend', 'ratio', 'p.ratio' 'N' (available data), respectively. Default zero length vector makes changes, .e. '[]', 'p.overall', 'p.trend', 'ratio', 'p.ratio' 'N' labels appear descriptives entire cohort, global p-value, p-value trend, HR/p-value HR/available data, respectively. caption character specifying table caption descriptives available data table. .table='' first element 'caption' assigned descriptives table second available data table. set "", caption inserted. Default value NULL, writes 'Summary descriptives table groups 'y” descriptives table 'Available data groups 'y” available data table. width character string specify width first column descriptive table. Default value Inf makes first column autoadjust variable names. examples '10cm', '3in' '30em'. strip logical. shadows table lines corresponding variable. first.strip logical. determines whether shadow first variable (TRUE) second (FALSE). applies strip argument true. background color code HEX format shadowed lines. can use rgb function convert red, green blue HEX code. Default color '#D2D2D2'. size numeric. Size descriptive table. Default value NULL creates table default size. landscape logical. determines whether place table landscape (horizontal) format. applies format 'latex'. Default value FALSE. numcompiled integer. Number times LaTeX code compiled. creating table may necessary execute code several times order fit columns widths. default compiled twice. header.background color character table header 'NULL'. Default value 'NULL'. header.color color character table header text. Default color 'NULL'.

title: Exports tables to PDF files. — export2pdf

what: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
title: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
text: functions returns table non-available frequencies already build bivariate table.

title: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
code: missingTable(obj,...)

title: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
text: obj either 'compareGroups' 'createTable' object. ... arguments passed createTable.

title: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
text: object class 'createTable'. details, see 'value' section createTable help file.

title: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
text: function returns object class 'createTable', therefore methods implemented 'createTable' objects can applied, except 'update' method. arguments createTable can passed throught '...' argument, except 'hide.' argument fixed inside code changed. function applied stratified tables, .e. 'rbind.createTable' 'cbind.createTable'. stratified missingness table desired, apply function first table use cbind.createTable /rbind.createTable functions combine exactly way 'createTable' objects. See 'example' section .

title: Table of missingness counts by groups. — missingTable
code: require(compareGroups)  # load regicor data data(regicor)  # table of descriptives by recruitment year res <- compareGroups(year ~ age + sex + smoker + sbp + histhtn +           chol + txchol + bmi + phyact + pcs + death, regicor) restab <- createTable(res, hide.no = "no")  # missingness table missingTable(restab,type=1) #> Warning: the standard deviation is zero #> Warning: the standard deviation is zero #>  #>  #> -------- Summary of results by groups of 'year'--------- #>  #>  #>    var     N    p.value  method      selection #> 1  age     2294 .        categorical ALL       #> 2  sex     2294 .        categorical ALL       #> 3  smoker  2294 0.010**  categorical ALL       #> 4  sbp     2294 <0.001** categorical ALL       #> 5  histhtn 2294 0.015**  categorical ALL       #> 6  chol    2294 <0.001** categorical ALL       #> 7  txchol  2294 <0.001** categorical ALL       #> 8  bmi     2294 0.318    categorical ALL       #> 9  phyact  2294 <0.001** categorical ALL       #> 10 pcs     2294 <0.001** categorical ALL       #> 11 death   2294 0.001**  categorical ALL       #> ----- #> Signif. codes:  0 '**' 0.05 '*' 0.1 ' ' 1  #>  #>  #> --------Missingness table by 'year'--------- #>  #> ____________________________________  #>         1995  2000   2005  p.overall  #>         N=431 N=786 N=1077            #> ¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯  #> age     0.00% 0.00% 0.00%      .      #> sex     0.00% 0.00% 0.00%      .      #> smoker  3.71% 3.56% 1.58%    0.010    #> sbp     0.70% 1.40% 0.00%   <0.001    #> histhtn 0.00% 0.00% 0.74%    0.015    #> chol    6.50% 9.03% 0.19%   <0.001    #> txchol  0.00% 1.65% 3.90%   <0.001    #> bmi     1.86% 1.91% 1.11%    0.318    #> phyact  14.8% 2.80% 0.19%   <0.001    #> pcs     7.89% 15.6% 7.71%   <0.001    #> death   10.2% 6.11% 5.01%    0.001    #> ¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯¯    if (FALSE) { # what: Update p values according multiple comparisons — padjustCompareGroups
title: Update p values according multiple comparisons — padjustCompareGroups
text: Given compareGroups object, returns p-values adjusted using one several methods (stats::p.adjust)

title: Update p values according multiple comparisons — padjustCompareGroups
code: padjustCompareGroups(object_compare, p = "p.overall", method = "BH")

title: Update p values according multiple comparisons — padjustCompareGroups
text: Jordi Real <jordireal<>gmail.com>

title: Update p values according multiple comparisons — padjustCompareGroups
text: object_compare object class compareGroups p character string. Specify p-value must corrected. Possible values 'p.overall' 'p.trend' (default: 'p.overall') method Correction method, character string. Can abbreviated (see p.adjust).

title: Update p values according multiple comparisons — padjustCompareGroups
text: compareGroups class corrected p-values
